page.title: 16ST. MICHAEL'S HOSPICE
page.content: { St.Michael's Hospice}is to be found adjoining the{Bartestree Convent,}and its purpose is to treat people who have{terminal illnesses,}usually cancer patients. The nurses do their best to make the last weeks and months of the patient's lives as comfortable as possible. The hospice was built in 1980, designed by architect Mr.Nigel Dees, but was planned as far back as 1970. Funds from the{Freda Pearce {Foundation}as well as other charities and private donations, raised the money to build the hospital, which is still paid for by charities and private fund raising, and is unconnected with the National Health Service. The largest number of people who may stay at any one time is 10, out of a catchment area of all Herefordshire.
